results.title: House of treasures: the magic eye
results.brief_description: Illustrates the development of photographic technology through an exposition of archival photos of colonial Australia. Reveals some of the techniques and processes used in early photographic work, and highlights several old cameras. Quaint and static in its exploration of historical depiction of idiomatic Australia. Narrated by Noel Brophy.

results.title: House of sand and fog
results.creator_credit: NBCUniversal, Colbalt Media Group, Michael London and Vadim Perelman
results.brief_description: The is a film about a house which, due to a bureaucratic blunder, is sold in error. Conflict arrises between the now two owners. The original owner played by Jennifer Connelly, a recovering addict, does not want to give the house up. The new owner (Ben Kinsley) having recently fled from Iran with his family feels the same way. The film stands out for its fine acting both powerful and emotional. Themes such as the importance of a home and a persons place are told. Each owner has a compelling story and it seems are equally worthy in this moving conflict. This suspensful fine drama was nominated for three Academy Awards.

results.title: House of knowledge
results.creator_credit: RKO Pathe Pictures and Larry O'Reilly
results.brief_description: A panoramic study of the Smithsonian Institution, which supplies its immense collection of art and museum pieces largely by its own exploration and searching. Mentions briefly ethnology, biology, entomology and other sciences - giving glimpses of work in each field. Shows field teams investigating a new volcano, and archaeologists in Mexico.

results.title: House in the jungle
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission and John Power
results.brief_description: Follows the journey of a group of peasants from central Java to a new settlement in Sumatra in an official migration scheme, showing some of Indonesia’s national problems of economic and political life incidentally.

results.title: House afire
results.brief_description: A short instructional cautionary film describing the dangers of fire - particularly bushfires during the 1950s and 1960s, accompanied by footage of the fires. A narrator details simple ways in which house holders can protect their homes against destruction.

results.title: Houdini never died
results.brief_description: Examines the pervasive influence of Houdini on magicans throughout the world. Contains rare footage of Houdini and shows other noted magicans at work. Narrated by Burgess Meredith.

results.title: Houdini
results.creator_credit: Leanne Moore, Turner Network Television, Trilogy Entertainment Group and Pen Densham
results.brief_description: The life story of Harry Houdini is dramatically presented in “Houdini”. From his humble beginnings pressing garments during the day and mastering his skills as an illusionist at night, the character of Houdini evolves. One fateful night he meets Bess (Stacy Edwards) and asks her to marry him the same day. The pair marry and Bess joins him on stage as his assistant. Houdini soon realises that to be the greatest, he must convince the audience he will die. From this premise, the legend of Houdini is born. This feature successfully portrays both the legend and the man, with interesting insights into Houdini’s struggle for the love and acceptance of his mother and the great burden this places on his marriage. As Houdini ages, he becomes obsessed with the existence of the after life, vowing to escape death as he escapes.

results.title: Hottest day of the year: plus four other stories
results.creator_credit: Jackie Cockle, Ellen Meske and Cosgrove Hall Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Animal shelf”.
Five stories are contained on this tape comprising THE HOTTEST DAY OF THE YEAR, THE WORLD IN THE WOOD, WOEFUL FLIES TO THE MOON, CAPTAIN GUMPA and THE ALARM CLOCK. THE HOTTEST DAY OF THE YEAR: There is a prize to be won for the animals who can come up with the best way of keeping cool on the hottest day of the year. When all their efforts fail, Timothy brings home the winning idea. THE WORLD IN THE WOOD: The animals build themselves houses to protect themselves from wolves after hearing the story of the Three Little Pigs. Woeful has his own plans, plans which backfire when they discover a puppy has escaped from the funfair. WOEFUL FLIES TO THE MOON: The animals become fascinated by the moon and decided they would like to visit it in a space rocket. Woeful claims to have been there and brought back a souvenir- or has he? CAPTAIN GUMPA: Timothy throws a party for Gumpa, the oldest animal on the shelf. Upset at being thought of as an old bear, Gumpa plans to build a boat and sail away. THE ALARM CLOCK: Timothy is given an alarm clock by his mother when he can’t get out of bed in the morning for school. After the alarm keeps going off in the middle of the night the animals hide it, however the clock keeps mysteriously reappearing.

results.title: Hotspot
results.brief_description: Shows the Nyiragongo Volcano in the Republic of Zaire, Africa. The visuals, set against the music of J.S. Bach, fill the screen with spectacular scenes of cracked earth, rivers of dried and molten lava, and gas explosions. Cauldrons of bubbling lava and geyser-like plumes of liquid rock shoot skywards from a smoking landscape.

results.title: Hotel New York
results.brief_description: This is the final version of “New York” shown by Jackie Raynal in 1980 as a work-in-progress. It is the story of Loulou Blanchot, a French filmmaker who decides to live in New York after having been invited to show one of her films there. Loulou begins to get acquainted with the city and gets a job as an editor for a porno film company.
